newsitem.title: USA: GTE hires investment adviser - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: GTE hires investment adviser - WSJ.

text.p: GTE Corp has hired international telecommunications deal maker Ignacio Santillana to pursue alliances, acquisitions and other investments outside the United States, the Wall Street Journal reported Monday.
The article, quoting people familiar with the plans, said GTE hired Santillana as part of its plans for a major expansion of its worldwide management and operations.
Under these plans GTE has also expanded the duties of its Latin American operations and development chief, the paper said.

Santillana, the former chief executive of Spain's Telefonica Internacional SA, or TISA, has spoken with GTE during the last two years about merging TISA's assets with GTE's international properties, the article said.
